questionnaire.name: 8. theBIKEnet Mobility Services â€“ Shared Use, Integration and Willingness to Pay

sections.title: Welcome to the theBIKEnet Mobility Services Questionnaire
sections.description:
ðŸš² theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities â€” combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This eighth questionnaire focuses on shared and public mobility services â€” such as bike sharing, e-scooter sharing, and public transport. It investigates how often you use these services, how you combine them, and what improvements could make them more accessible. Your feedback will help us design better-integrated, affordable, and sustainable mobility systems.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about the theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Use of Shared and Public Mobility Services
sections.description: How frequently you use shared vehicles or public transport, and how safe and comfortable you feel while doing so.

questions.text: How often do you use bike or e-bike sharing services?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1â€“2 times per week or at least twice per month)

questions.text: How often do you use e-scooter sharing services?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1â€“2 times per week or at least twice per month)

questions.text: How often do you use car sharing services?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1â€“2 times per week or at least twice per month)

questions.text: Do you currently have an ATAC / Metrebus public transport subscription?

options.text: I had one in the past
No, I do not have one

questions.text: When using shared bicycles or e-scooters, how safe and comfortable do you usually feel?

sections.title: Integration and Incentives
sections.description: Your experience with integrated services and what incentives would make you use shared mobility more often.

questions.text: What factors would influence your decision to use public transport?

options.text: If it offered shorter travel times, better connections, or more frequent services.
If there were the discounted tickets
If I had physical limitations that made cycling difficult
If it offered options like bike racks on buses or trains (for longer journeys)
When I'm running late or need to reach my destination quickly
If I felt unsafe cycling due to busy traffic, unsafe road conditions, or concerns about theft.

questions.text: If you were given free access to a shared bicycle or e-scooter, would you use it?
If you were given free bus or metro tickets, would you ride a bicycle or e-scooter more often?
What would most encourage you to use shared mobility services more often?

options.text: More reliable app or payment options

questions.text: Do you currently use or plan to use the micromobility discount (bike, e-scooter, or car sharing) linked to your ATAC / Metrebus subscription?

options.text: Yes, I plan to activate it
I was not aware of this discount
I am not eligible or was excluded from the program

sections.title: Cost and Willingness to Pay
sections.description: How affordable you find current services and your willingness to pay for improved public transport or faster travel times.

questions.text: How affordable do you find using a bicycle or an e-scooter (personal)?
How affordable do you find using a bicycle or an e-scooter (shared)?
Would you be willing to pay a higher fare for public transport if it meant improved service quality (e.g. more frequent buses or trains)?
Would you be willing to pay a higher fare for public transport if it meant less congestion and faster travel times?
